alert.note: Alert for Greenwood; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 11:17AM EST until January 13 at 7:28AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Wateree River Near Camden affecting Kershaw County. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Lexington, Calhoun and Richland Counties. Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Union and Newberry Counties. Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Lancaster, Kershaw and Fairfield Counties. Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Columbia affecting Lexington and Richland Counties. Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Marlboro and Chesterfield Counties. Saluda River At Chappells affecting Greenwood, Newberry and Saluda Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saluda River at Chappells. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Lowlands around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. Cattle grazing river bottomland should be moved to higher ground. At 16.0 feet, Extensive farmland and river bottomland around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. At 18.0 feet, The Saluda River Campground including the Campground Store downstream from Chappells becomes flooded. Campers should move to higher ground. At 21.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs. Farmland and river bottomland around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. Much of the Saluda River Campground downstream from Chappells become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Thursday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM EST Thursday was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 6.5 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EST.
